intro: Brachiaria bemarivensis subsp. ankarafantsikaensis, commonly known as the Ankarafantsika grass, is a rare and endemic plant species found in Madagascar. It belongs to the Poaceae family and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
